timeline.bodyText: These two pieces of code are not strictly equivalent. Are you sure this is what you want?
timeline.author: mschwager
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -215,9 +219,11 @@ def _generate_line(test_file, matches):
     )
 
 
-def invoke_semgrep_multi(filename, *args, **kwargs):
+def invoke_semgrep_multi(
+    filename: Path, *args: Path, **kwargs: Any
+) -> Tuple[Path, Optional[Exception], Any]:
     try:
-        output = invoke_semgrep(filename, *args, **kwargs)
+        output = invoke_semgrep(filename, list(args), **kwargs)

replies.bodyText: I can't figure out how this code was working before TBH, but invoke_semgrep definitely takes a list in that position.
replies.author: nbrahms

replies.bodyText:
If we look at config_with_tests we can see it contains data like:
ipdb> pp config_with_tests                                                                           
[(PosixPath('~/r2c/semgrep-rules/python/requests/security/no-auth-over-http.yaml'),
  [PosixPath('~/r2c/semgrep-rules/python/requests/security/no-auth-over-http.py')]),
 (PosixPath('~/r2c/semgrep-rules/python/requests/security/disabled-cert-validation.yaml'),
  [PosixPath('~/r2c/semgrep-rules/python/requests/security/disabled-cert-validation.py')]),
 (PosixPath('~/r2c/semgrep-rules/python/requests/best-practice/use-timeout.yaml'),
With starmap we pass these in as arguments to invoke_semgrep_multi. E.g.

filename -> PosixPath('~/r2c/semgrep-rules/python/requests/security/no-auth-over-http.yaml')
*args -> [PosixPath('~/r2c/semgrep-rules/python/requests/security/no-auth-over-http.py')] (but it could be more with additional positional arguments passed in)

invoke_semgrep_multi was meant to be a loose wrapper around invoke_semgrep with multiprocessing, so I went with *args and **kwargs. So it is true that list(args) will work, but that wasn't really the intent here. If someone passes in an additional positional argument it won't work as expected. I think you want *args: Any and no list in the invoke_semgrep call.
replies.author: mschwager

replies.bodyText: We could've even included filename in the *args passthru here, but we needed to return it below.
replies.author: mschwager

replies.bodyText: Let's not fight with the typechecker. We control the signature and call of the method, so let's just use it explicitly.
replies.author: nbrahms

replies.bodyText: FWIW I tested this on semgrep-rules and it does the right thing TM
replies.author: nbrahms
